      • applyTransformation

        public algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] applyTransformation​(TransformationParameters params,
                                                          algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] edges)
        transform the given edges using the given parameters. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
        Parameters:
        params -
        edges -
        Returns:

      • applyTransformation

        public algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] applyTransformation​(double rotInRadians,
                                                          double scale,
                                                          double translationX,
                                                          double translationY,
                                                          double centroidX,
                                                          double centroidY,
                                                          algorithms.util.PairIntArray[] edges)
        transform the given edges using the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        rotInRadians - rotation in radians. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
        scale -
        translationX - translation along x axis in pixels
        translationY - translation along y axis in pixels
        centroidX - the horizontal center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.
        centroidY - the vertical center of the reference frame for edges. this should be the center of the image if edges points are in the original image reference frame.
        edges -
        Returns:

      • applyTransformation

        public java.util.List<algorithms.util.PairIntArray> applyTransformation​(TransformationParameters params,

        transform the given edges using the given parameters. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
        Parameters:
        params -
        edges -
        Returns:

      • applyTransformation

        public Image applyTransformation​(Image input,
                                 TransformationParameters params,
                                 int outputWidth,
                                 int outputHeight)
        apply transformation params to image input. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule). NOTE that currently the additional data in an ImageExt beyond an Image instance is not transformed too.
        Parameters:
        input -
        params -
        outputWidth -
        outputHeight -
        Returns:

      • rotate

        public void rotate​(int rotationInDegrees,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   float[] outputX,
                   float[] outputY,
                   int outputIndex)
        apply rotationInDegrees to (x, y) and return the result in the arrays outputX and outputY. Note, the rotation is applied in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule).
        Parameters:
        rotationInDegrees -
        x -
        y -
        outputX -
        outputY -
        outputIndex -
